name: InterContinental Resort & Spa Moorea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just want to say that I have never reviewed a hotel with this high of remarks ever. My first review of a place where I did not have anything to complain about. This place has set the bar for all of my future hotel stays. I will try my best to hit every aspect of our stay.
reviews.title: Best Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) Rooms: Our stay was split in a beach bungalow and an over the water bungalow. Both of these places were just so perfect. My first thanks is to the cleaning staff. Both places were spotless. You could eat off of the floors. The staff were very respectful of our privacy which we greatly appreciated. They always greeted us and they always had a smile on their faces. The views were to die for. The lounge chairs were so comfortable with their big red cushions. These places came with a great flat screen TV on a swivel, but we really didn't need a TV.
reviews.title: Friendly and lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) Platinum Ambassador: The only way to go at the InterContinental. If you do not know about Ambassador status you need to look into it. It is worth every penny.
reviews.title: Quiet Retreat and Great Beach

reviews.text: 3) Landscaping: This places is just unreal. My hats off to the landscaping crew. The vegetation is well manicured as if it was a display at a major botanical conservatory. I do not recall seeing on piece of trash anywhere on the property for the entire stay.
reviews.title: Pleasant but not a 5 star hotel

reviews.text: 4)Food: The food is top notch. My wife can not stop talking about this Asian noodle dish that she had one night. Best part about eating here is the views. You always have a great view of the ocean, the pools, or the landscaping. The wait staff was really on it. Not one issue ever.
reviews.title: Average Hotel, but you're IN TAHITI!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room was very nice and private. The Property was very average. We went out to dinner every night, so the Hotel arranged for pick up- The Restuarants will only pick you up at the Hotel, if there is another couple at your Hotel that is going to the same Resturant. We were lucky, we had another couple going out every night. My favorite is Rudy's. We went on excursions everyday, so we did not spend much time at the Hotel. While reading a response from Thierry B,(Manager) to another reviewer- I was taken back. Thierry B. stated that bringing your own alcohol- is considered misbehaving. Well I guess I misbehaved alot. What is wrong with bringing your own bottle in the Privacy of your room- and having coctails on your deck while enjoying the view. I did buy several beers at the bar-not finding it too expensive $7.00 dollars. My husband and I would fix a cocktail in our room at night. I thought his/her respond was unprofessional and rude. Every morning the front desk would have local artist that would come in and set up tables with their goods. I bought several items everyday-Not too expensive. I did like this Hotel, but it did not have the "WOW" factor. We left and went to the InterContinental Thalasso in Bora Bora, now that Resort had the "WOW" factor. And yes I did misbehave every chance I could get.
reviews.title: Its not the Thalasso

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone at the Hotel was very friendly and nice. The Beds were very comfortable, Had alots of bugs in room- They looked like sand ants- all over the sink and vanity. But thats normal for a tropical paradise. Also watch out for the geckos- all over the walls and the ceilings. I am used to them, I live in Texas, so I embraced the little critters. They also have swim with the Dolphins- did not partake in that activity-
reviews.title: Intercontinental Resort Moorea

reviews.text: We stayed in the Intercontinental Moorea Resort & Spa after our Paul Gauguin cruise. This was a great place to unwind (not that we needed more unwinding) before flying home. There's a swimmable lagoon what winds through the chain of bungalows. And the beach offers all kinds of water sports. You won't want to miss the weekly (Sunday evening, I think) Polynesian dinner on the beach. The dancers are excellent. The Intercontinental seems like a good place for kids, too, because of easy to access water sports. BTW, Moorea is right across from Tahiti and an interesting island to visit...lots to see and do.
reviews.title: Very Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There're coral heads and tropical fish in the protected lagoon - even the elusive Picasso Triggerfish. What a sight! Nothing better than waking up and taking a before-breakfast swim. You'll need a big one to handle the InterContinental's breakfast buffet! Note: our winter (in US) is their hot, rainy season. So plan accordingly.
reviews.title: Visit Moorea First, Bora Bora Second

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My expectations for this hotel exceeded the actuality of our visit. There was nothing impressive about this hotel. They do not have more then 3-4 true overwater bungalows. While they consider a majority of them overwater~ indeed a portion of the bungalow is overwater while a majority is actually over land.
reviews.title: Moorea Honeymoon Stay

reviews.text: I was in Tahiti on business for a few weeks and everyone said i had to go to Moorea and as i was going alone decided to treat myself.
reviews.title: Absolute Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful - from the impressive drive in and grounds to the impressive lobby. The staff were friendly, polite and very very helpful, and my room was out of this world. I was staying in one of the overwater bungalows and its so worth upgrading - incredible views and lots of privacy.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were extremely helpful, food was fantastic and nothing was too much trouble for the concierge team.
reviews.title: Fun and Relaxing

reviews.text: I will be coming back here because it was the best hotel i've ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Enjoyed one night stay here

reviews.text: The ONLY negative thing, and it isnt the fault of the hotel, were the jetskis - they start at 8am and continue through the day and come ridiculously close to the bungalows - I saw a near miss where someone was snorkelling and the person on the jetski didnt see them until the very last moment - could have been very nasty. These jetskis need to be stopped in Moorea as the scare the wildlife, are a massive carbon footprint and invade much sought-after privacy
reviews.title: Relaxation with a View
Can't fault it
reviews.text: This resort is amazing. We stayed in an overwater bungalow right next to the dolphin enclosure. The water is amazing. It's like having an aquarium at your door step. Shark and stingray encounters are common and only a short paddle away from the resort (less than a few hundred meters). The weather was perfect and it's fantastic to have an overwater bungalow as you get a constant cool breeze. I highly recommend the resort and the island. I'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really loved this resort, especially the room. We enrolled in the Ambassadors Club and received an upgrade from the cheapest hotel lanai room to the garden bungalow [#415] with it's own plunge pool which we used a lot and the bungalow was at the edge of the property so we had GREAT privacy. We even had a view of the water which most garden bungalows do not...Loved it! We only ate at the resort once and had a club sandwich and a panini, with the club being very good and the panini just so so. Drink prices are high here [$7 for a beer, tabu was our fav and $12 to $22 for a cocktail] so we bought our favorite liquors at duty free in LAX and bought mixers at the market across from the resort and just call for ice. Could even bring a empty water bottle to breakfast for juice for drinks later, no one cares.
reviews.title: Great resort in paradise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tips:Recommend Snack Mahana [#2] for lunch. It is a 20 min walk [left out of resort] and was one of our favorite meals in FP.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Enjoyed Rudy's[ #3] for dinner but didn't like Moorea Beach Cafe [didn't understand the #1 rating until I saw that more than 1/2 of their reviewers had only one 1 review, theirs...hummm].
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort
Nice casual experience
reviews.text: Had Albert Transport/Tours pick us up at the airport and drop us off for $12 each, each way and used them for our Lagoon Excursion/Picnic and 4X4 tour. Both were far less than other tours and we booked online by email and got even cheaper rates! They also didn't demand a credit card or prepayment to reserve their services.

aka: Intercontinental Resort & Spa Moorea Hotel Moorea
description: InterContinental Moorea Resort & Spa is nestled between mountains and a lagoon on a stunning French Polynesian island. Right on the resort grounds is Moorea s widest range of activities, which includes the Moorea Dolphin Center, Bathys Diving Club, tennis, kayaking, canoeing, skiing and Jeep tours. The Arahurahu Marae temple is also worth a visit.
